title: Philosophers of Nothingness: An Essay on the Kyoto School
description: Philosophers of Nothingness examines the three principal figures of what has come to be known as the "Kyoto school" -- Nishida Kitar≈ç, Tanabe Hajime, and Keiji Nishitani -- and shows how this original current of twentieth-century Japanese thought challenges traditional philosophy to break out of its Western confines and step into a world forum.
author: James W. Heisig
